specifics.specific: communicate in simple contexts using basic vocabulary and phrases (e.g., close the door, come here);
participate in structured oral language activities appropriate for the grade (e.g., provide appropriate phrases for pictures or illustrations);
respond appropriately to questions using phrases (e.g., I have two books, there are three bears);
demonstrate an understanding of simple oral messages using both verbal and non-verbal cues.

specifics.specific: read phrases using the alphabet or syllabics chart, pictures, and other visual aids;
demonstrate an understanding of the phrases they read (e.g., by matching phrases to pictures);
participate in structured reading activities appropriate for the grade (e.g., identify phrases that describe an action);
use visual cues (e.g., pictures, illustrations) to determine the meaning of phrases;
recognize phrases that have been introduced orally;
